<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.8 is: A function parameter should not be modified.
Note that the object referred to by a pointer parameter may be modified, but the pointer itself shall not be modified.
</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of OS_PthreadTaskEntry:
```c
static void *OS_PthreadTaskEntry(void *arg)
{
    OS_VoidPtrValueWrapper_t local_arg;

    /* cppcheck-suppress unreadVariable // intentional use of other union member */
    local_arg.opaque_arg = arg;
    OS_TaskEntryPoint(local_arg.id); /* Never returns */

    return NULL;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function OS_PthreadTaskEntry:
typedef union
{
    void *           opaque_arg;
    OS_ArgCallback_t arg_callback_func;
    osal_id_t        id;
    osal_index_t     idx;
} OS_VoidPtrValueWrapper_t
...
void OS_TaskEntryPoint(osal_id_t task_id)
{
    osal_task_entry task_entry;

    if (OS_TaskPrepare(task_id, &task_entry) == OS_SUCCESS)
    {
        if (task_entry != NULL)
        {
            (*task_entry)();
        }
    }

    /* If the function returns, treat as a normal exit and do the proper cleanup */
    OS_TaskExit();
}
</additional code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: No code fragment in OS_PthreadTaskEntry modifies the function parameter 'arg'. The parameter is only read and its value is copied into local_arg.opaque_arg (a local union member) — copying the pointer does not modify the parameter itself. There are no assignments to 'arg' and no operations that change the pointer value. The subsequent call OS_TaskEntryPoint(local_arg.id) uses the union's integer member derived from the copied pointer value; that does not modify the parameter either. Therefore, there are no violations of MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.8 in the provided code fragment.
